Comment: I move my king's pawn to give his bishop and queen some freedom...
...and he does likewise...
...and I move my queen's pawn to give her bishop freedom...
...then we trade pawns, keeping with the Centre Game...
...then we trade pawns, keeping with the Centre Game...
...then he moves his queen's pawn one space to free her bishop and to keep the pawn...
...and I now bring out my knight...
...which is instantly attacked by his bishop...
...so I move up my bishop...
...and I trade my knight for his bishop, but maintain a reasonable pawn structure.
...and I trade my knight for his bishop, but maintain a reasonable pawn structure.
He now moves his knight out, attacking my queen...
...so I move her back...
...and he develops his queen...
...and I bring out my knight...
...and he castles queenside to remove some of the protection on the castling rook's pawn...
...so my knight targets it, as I have move control over its square (queen on e3 and knight on b5 v knight on c6)...
...forcing it to move...
...so my knight advances to the 7th rank to fork the king and knight...
...but he declines to take my knight with his...
...so my bishop attacks...
...to force the king to his starting file...
